snippet: The military said the regular patrols are meant to protect the thousands of miles of coastline suddenly open to other countries’ ships on a regular basis.
abstract: Russia announces plans to sail regular naval patrols along shipping lanes that have opened in its Arctic territory due to record melting of Arctic ice caused by climate change; other nations hoping to stake claims to nearby resource-rich waters worry about military buildup.
lead_paragraph: The military said the regular patrols are meant to protect the thousands of miles of coastline suddenly open to other countries’ ships on a regular basis.

headline.main: Russia Preparing Patrols of Arctic Shipping Lanes
headline.print_headline: Russia Preparing Patrols Of Arctic Shipping Lanes
